question: Who breaks the World Record for cycling around the world by 44 days?
explanation: Mark Beaumont broke the world record for cycling around the world - by 44 days. The 34-year-old, from Perthshire, arrived in Paris one day ahead of schedule having cycled the 18,000-mile route in 79 days. He was on his bike for more than 16 hours a day and only slept for five hours each night.
